intro: Crotalaria holoptera, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and small, elliptical leaves. Its seed pods are elongated and contain several oblong seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. Crotalaria holoptera is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it a useful plant in certain agricultural contexts.
